message.content:
To calculate how long one notepad would last if someone writes 10 notes per day, we first need to determine how many notes can be written on a single notepad. Since Harmony folds paper three times and then cuts along the lines, she creates 8 smaller note papers from one sheet of paper (2^3 = 8).

So there are 8 notes that can be written on one notepad. 

Now we need to determine how many notepads would be needed for 10 notes per day:

neededNotepadsPerDay = desiredNotesPerDay / notesPerNotepad
neededNotepadsPerDay = 10 / 8

So, 1.25 notepads would be needed per day. 

Since a part of a notepad is not considered a full one, we can conclude that one notepad would last for more than 1 day (specifically, 1.25 days) if someone writes 10 notes per day.
